website_summaries.verdict: Just as skilled at quickly shearing away fur as it is making precise trims, this dog clipper is a versatile tool that professionals will appreciate.
pros: Adjusts between 5 speeds for additional control
cons: A fairly expensive dog clipper, but groomers should consider it an investment

customer_reviews.title: 99% Sure These Are Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: So I decided to order a pair of these clippers since I'm training to become a professional groomer for Pet Supplies Plus. I saw the reviews and yet I still decided to buy them in the hopes that none of it was true. But lo and behold, just as the top rated critical review said, my clippers came with poorly etched serial numbering, sunken buttons, a scuffed up #10 blade, and a lack of product manufacture date on the power supply. I am so PISSED. Do NOT waste your time purchasing this product. I'm not the type to leave a negative review but PLEASE don't let yourself get scammed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used clippers
customer_reviews.text: VERY disappointed. I am a groomer and I was so excited opening my new pair of pink clippers, yet I can tell it's been used!!!!! I ordered a new pair, not a used pair. I noticed it right away, the small wear on the clippers. Thanks. Returning tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn

customer_reviews.title: These clippers are wonderful for hand and arm fatigue
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional dog groomer with 20 plus years experience. I groom a minimum of eight dogs a day. These clippers are wonderful for hand and arm fatigue. There are minor issues with blades getting hotter than on my older clippers but i frequently change blades out so no worries. I am OCD about clipper maintenance. I change blade drive as needed. My other Andis clipper is 15 years old and still running great. I just wanted something smaller and lighter. These are perfect and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: batfum

customer_reviews.title: Usually andis is a good brand. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Buttons on side of clipper sink into the device when pressed. This includes the on off switch and the speed arrows. Literally did not get through grooming one dog and this happened . Had requested a replacement but that will take almost a month, so no thanks. I'll spend my money on something that works. Usually andis is a good brand. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Y.

customer_reviews.title: Short in cord
customer_reviews.text: The cord keeps tripping out on my new pair. Less then a month old . It's a shame Because my pair before this pair works for me over five years.
customer_reviews.author: Dh8

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these clippers to ANYONE
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these clippers and they are an outstanding workhorse clipper. Quiet and very reliable. However, I did learn the valuable lesson of buying Amazon Prime as I truly needed them ASAP. They were purchased from a business that was NOT Amazon Prime and I waited.....and waited. I own a grooming business and needed them immediately. Never again, and I WILL make sure of the seller working with Amazon Prime in the future. I would recommend these clippers to ANYONE, very lightweight so easy on your hands and forearms.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya M. Neve

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I expected better. I'veused this 5 times and am already having issues with the power switch. It feels like cheap plastic and isn't much lighter than my previous Andis blade.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Easy for Amateurs to Use
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the current "shelter in place" requirement in Texas, I have been forced to start grooming my 1-year-old Aussiedoodle. I bought this clipper and a grooming table to make the job as easy and comfortable as possible for us both. This clipper takes my dog's fur off very efficiently, and doesn't bother her. It's also very easy for an amateur like me to use. I had already planned on grooming my dog at some point rather than pay someone else to do it since she gets a very basic cut (even all around). Now that I've bought all of the equipment needed, I'll continue to groom her myself going forward.
customer_reviews.author: heylo

customer_reviews.title: Meh.....he naked now
customer_reviews.text: Poodle Monster had fur and long nails. Poodle Monster was strapped to specially designed and very spensive canid restrainment device. Poodle Monster was exposed to various forms of human-canid torture. Claw-less, and fur-less Poodle Monster proceeded to attempt to utilize intact African Crocodilian bite force and razor sharp oral structures to inflict vengeance on all humans present during this process. Fur removal torture implement survived the initial use in fur removal, and subsequent use as Poodle Monster Bite Decoy. This buyer would recommend to a friend. The fur removal device, certainly not the Poodle Monster.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Lightest, fastest clippers around
customer_reviews.text: I had an oster 3 speed before this and these clippers are so much more lighter and the 5 speed really helps for thick hair and because it is small it's usefully for shaving faces since your not shoving a giant buzzing thing in the dogs face. But Holy shnarkie does it ever get hot! It's best to use the 1 speed when your not in a hurry since these clippers get hot fast. I bought the confetti pair because it's so unique all the groomers have these clippers so I tried to be different. Definitely buy the standard packaging though the ones who bought frustration free seem to be receiving used pairs.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good with caveats
customer_reviews.text: This product is lightweight and quiet, well quieter than the AG2, but it sometimes quits working. Almost like the blade is stuck or the unit is underpowered for the task. You have to be patient with it and turn it off and on a few times to get it to work again. The buttons are recessed, I'm guessing to prevent accidentally pushing one, and kind of hard to be confident you're actually pushing them. The buttons themselves are easy to push though. My sausage fingers have a hard time though. The unit runs cool enough to get through a whole goldendoodle without burning your hand. If you didn't already know, getting multiple blades is a must to prevent animal damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Clipper but Power Cord Will Eventually Wear Out
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this clipper a5-star rating is the likelihood that the power cord will go bad after a year of daily use, just like the previous 3 I've had before. The cord's design doesn't take into consideration the amount of bending and twisting that goes on during the process, and the wires wear and have to be re-soldered.
customer_reviews.author: Harl

customer_reviews.title: do not seem to hold up very well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second clipper in a little more than a year. My wife shows and breeds dogs and is constantly grooming one of them. Clippers are used very little on her dogs but she will occasionally groom a friends dog and does use them. The new clipper is already having issues and the older set only works when it wants to. The problem appears to be in the switch. I have not gone back to Andis with the problem since she cannot do without clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Gino

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot
customer_reviews.text: Best grooming tool I have ever owned. I would buy it again. However, I'm not sure how professional groomers do this due to the heat that builds up; they must have at least 2-3 that they interchange to let the others cool down. As a result of having one grooming tool and two dogs, the grooming took longer than I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer works great. The trick is in the blades!
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot. This trimmer works very well. All blades get HOT. If you read blades, “do not get hot” it’s a lie. Any groomer knows to have a few different blades when they start to get to warm, you switch out. The trimmer will not get warm only the blades. This trimmer is fairly quiet. The second time trimming a very scared dog about a month later he was okay with me trimming around his head.
customer_reviews.author: Grindstone

customer_reviews.title: Fix the commonly known issues with this model clipper! Please!
customer_reviews.text: Literally every single pair I’ve had (3) have broken inside of 9 months of purchase. I continued to purchase because they are more lightweight then other corded clippers, plus have 5 speeds and don’t require 5in1 blades. But I’m not sure I’ll continue to purchase any more until Andis updates this model with fixes for the common issues for break down (on/off button malfunction, clipper cord dislodged even with a monkey tail protector) I’ll just deal with a little heavier clipper that will actually work for longer than a year from purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kylie

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it's the color??
customer_reviews.text: I've used Andis Pro clippers for many years. Even this particular model. For some reason the last one I got (blue) is not always functional. Loses power to move the blade on larger blades and just locks up and doesn't turn on. Very frustrating. The blue was quite a few dollars cheaper, and as I don't really care about color, I chose this one. I can use them sometimes, but most times, I'm resorting back to my old pair. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: TRyder

customer_reviews.title: worth the money if you have a dog with super thick and hard to cut hair like my dogs
customer_reviews.text: worth the money if you have a dog with super thick and hard to cut hair like my dogs. he is a bouvier and has very thick hair and this cuts through it like butter. It does overheat a lot on highest setting which can be annoying, but i just set it down and give it a break so that it doesn't burn my dog and resume after 5 mins or so after letting it cool. also doesn't come with any guards, which i was surprised about considering the price, so buy guards separately
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: I’ll stick with them
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been grooming about 5 years now, only one year being full time. I love these clippers. The first set I got about 3 years ago. They just recently started tripping out. I’d say for the price I’m happy with how long they lasted. I considered switching to other brands to try but in the end decided to just get the same ones again. They cut like butter and make any job doable.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Warrick

customer_reviews.title: They will eventually slow down a lot!
customer_reviews.text: they worked for a month then they slowed down and couldn't even move the blade to cut! not surprised ,clippers are usually heavy these are the lightest ones they make and thats the reason I bought them, had them for the past few years and always have issues!
customer_reviews.author: D.Anastasiou

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Although the clippers were lighter and smaller, I still had to change blades, oil and spray to keep them from overheating. I was not as happy with the ceramic blades as I thought I would be. I wound up using my A5 clippers that I was hoping to replace. I would NOT buy them again, especially since I paid more for them than the A5 Oster clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Clearly NOT new! busted box and broken clippers
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? My box was delivered like this, busted and not sealed. Miraculously the blade wasnt broken, but the clippers dont even work! Already started my return process.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Love these clippers
customer_reviews.text: Love these clippers! I have read a few reviews saying something about a number being etched in the back next to the blade release. These are infact andis clipper, not knock offs. Andis started putting these numbers on the back as a better way to keep track for returns, reapairs, And any other issue you may be having with them. The first four numbers/letters are the manufacturing number. The last numbers are the date it was manufactured. All in all I have always been a huge fan of the andis excel clippers. They are powerful yet light. The adjustable speed is great for all dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlind

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight, easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint is the buttons are not in an ergo friendly area. Otherwise I love these clippers. They are small, and I wear a ladies Small glove, so they are perfect for my hands. I also have arthritis, the weight doesn’t seem to be a problem. Make sure you trip the close areas first because like every other clipper I’ve ever used, they get hot fairly quick. No overheating. I don’t suggest washing the blades, I’ve read complaints of the steel staining. Just brush them well and use a blade cleaner. Oil them up, and store. Too bad they didn’t come in a case, expensive clippers to not have a case to protect the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by a groomer
customer_reviews.text: These clippers weigh less than a pound. I've had this type of clipper for years. Long lasting if well maintained. I bought this as an extra pair. Nice gripper. Only trouble I've had is having to replace the cord. I had to on my other pair once. Didnt stop me from buying another pair. That's how much I love them. I have wrist pain. I can't have a heavy clipper. This comes from a professional groomer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely ADORE these clippers. I am a groomer in training and all of my coworkers have complimented me on how QUIET and light this thing is. I don't have much to compare it to because I'm starting out but the other groceries love that its a rubber button instead of a switch and the design is cute too. Only downfall is they get hot pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie & James  ❤️

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Well I feel duped, this clipper just stopped working. Take to repair guy and he says this was altered where cord met clipper meaning this was used stuff, I am pissed, I also had issues with blades being dull NO MORE BUYING GROOMING PRODUCTS ON AMAZON SO PISSED
customer_reviews.author: CocoaMO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect... Cuts like butter... I love these
customer_reviews.text: I love these... My dog looks like he came straight from the groomer... They cut like butter... They do heat up but order another blade so you can switch them out... Best clippers I’ve ever owned... I love the fact they are detachable easy to clean easy to switch out five speed I can lower the speed to do inside the years between the feet and his bottom
customer_reviews.author: alice

customer_reviews.title: Andis...You Really Missed the Mark on This One!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I will be returning this clipper. I am a professional groomer and although I loved the weight and feel of my new clipper, I will be returning this clipper because the blade HEATS up so fast that I cannot get though 1/4 of a toy poodle! The lowest speed is worthless and the middle speed heats the blade with in seconds. I believe that this clipper would be DANGEROUS in the hands of a home groomer. The cord is stiff and interferes with my movement. ANDIS...YOU REALLY MISSED THE MARK ON THIS ONE. I will be using my 7 year old AGC until I find a reliable safe replacement
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B. Trattner

customer_reviews.text: I’ve always loved these clippers, but this one I bought here came with a messed up button and cord, louder than my first pink andis 5 speed I bought at the store. Totally damaged item or was not refurbished correctly..
customer_reviews.author: Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Not quiet as advertised, returned.. the clippers are actually very nice, but I ordered them because they were supposed to be really quiet.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: Used clipped ?? NOT NEW!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional groomer, I used this clipped for 8 months and it wasn't working well. I had my professional blade sharpener and repair man fix it. He said what did you do to it. I said what do you mean? When he opened it up, It had electrical tape inside and wires etc were tampered with?? I bought it new this way?
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Would def buy again if needed!
customer_reviews.text: I love this clipper! It used to take me hours to clip my standard poodle with the Wahl brand clipper I bought from Walmart. I can slip my dog in under and hour now. The power/speed of this clipper is a necessity when clipping a large breed dog like the standard poodle I have.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Too hot.
customer_reviews.text: I groom my three Shih-tzus and was tired of getting blades every month or so. I decided to get a quality clipper. The clipper has a thick cord and seems like a good clipper but heats in in a few minutes and just does not work as well as my old ones. Still have to use the old one. Not happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Mason

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work great
customer_reviews.text: It's iffy. I directly compare my new Andis Excel 5 speed on it's highest setting to an older Andis model it's highest 2of2 setting and the older Andis is much smoother and even a shave. When I use my Andis Excel 5 speed to do a lift, it doesn't look like I did anything. I sent it I for a repair under warranty and it doesn't get as hot as quickly now, but it still just doesn't do a good job. It'll work for smooth haired medium coarse breeds, but you're out of luck if it's a silky, thick or coated breed. Stopped using it for grooming.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight workhorse clippers
customer_reviews.text: I was using the black oster cordless clippers but they were way too heavy. These are a little lighter snd the weight is distributed differently so its more ergonomic. My only complaint was how they were mailed - in the product box with a packing slip stuck on the side, not in a cardboard mailing box. Anyone could have stolen them seeing what they were.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Andis replace bad clipper?
customer_reviews.text: Started using this clipper as soon as it came in. I’ve replaced blade drives every other week since. Seems like they overheat super fast! I’ll be replacing these with the wahl km10 unless andis would like to replace with the same but better quality. Could be a bad clipper and not the whole line???
customer_reviews.author: Myra Locke

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: Clippers were supposed to be new. I was sent a set that had someone else's hair in it. I have had this same set before, so I know they work well. They are easy to use, and the 5 speeds make them useful with undercoats and hair that is knotted, etc. A good set of clippers. I'm just mad that I paid for new and got used clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it but the cord always breaks after time
customer_reviews.text: I have been grooming for 4 1/2 years and only use these clippers. Love the 5 speed especially the low setting for puppies. Only thing disappointing is the cord breaks after a certain amount of use, even having a monkey cord on it, it still tangles easily and I end up having to buy a whole new pair of these clippers just due to the cord. I wish I knew how to easily replace just the cord or send it to be fixed instead of buying a whole new clipper. They do last a while though I have had 3 of them in about 4 1/2 years and wouldn't recommend any other clipper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overheats
customer_reviews.text: Heats too quickly! Paid too much for it to get as hot as it does. Have to rest it in ice every five minutes so I don't burn my hand or my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Eanes

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality clipper priced right.
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my wife and she said its pretty nice. Much better than her other clippers. The different speeds is great and we like the picture of the little dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Rice

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: Can't really post much since I bought this as a Christmas gift. If does change speeds and arrived fast but as far as cutting, not able to try it out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mom3kids

customer_reviews.title: So light, very efficient, but gets crazy hot super fast
customer_reviews.text: Those are my all time favorite clippers, they are so good for my hands cause they’re small and light, they have a good grip and so comfortable to use, they’re also very silent. My only complaint is how hot the blade gets in so little time, best option would be having two of each blade to switch or prepare to use a ton of cool lube. Still I don’t think I’d trade for any other model, I have tried my coworkers clippers and I just couldn’t do it, so heavy and loud, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: yasmin

customer_reviews.title: These really are the best clippers. They have a very low setting for ...
customer_reviews.text: These really are the best clippers. They have a very low setting for dogs that are afraid of clippers and higher settings for different things. My only issue is that over the last 5 years I've gone through three of them. They do sell replacement parts but they just don't work the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C

customer_reviews.title: Groomers Dont waste your money go to andis online
customer_reviews.text: Update..... they didnt even last 4 months i am a pro groomer i had an oster pair that lasted me 4 yrs the fact that these died and just turned on and off over and over but quit actually cutting really is unacceptable. Even after changing blade drive they still dont work andis will not replace.. They are amazing love the feel and they are lightweight
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the others.
customer_reviews.text: The on/off switch a bit difficult for my old fingers to depress, but the ease of cutting through my poodle's very thick coat is a blessing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer  jkreader

customer_reviews.title: Best grooming clipper ever
customer_reviews.text: I had my last Andis clippers for7 yrs using them every day don't forget to change your blade drive once a month and they will make you a very happy groomer
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clippers!!
customer_reviews.text: Loveeee these! Light weight, easy to use, very good clippers! I have been grooming dogs for almost a year now, purchased these about 5 months ago & I am so glad I did! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Wright

customer_reviews.title: Thick cord/restricts movement
customer_reviews.text: Awkward to hold due to the thick cord. I decided to upgrade to this model because of the sleek design of the clipper itself. I failed to pay attention to the cord or the plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Please read before biying
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife who is a dog groomer...as soon as she held them she knew something was wrong. They felt heavier than her other pair of the same brand. They came all scratched up and the comb was all dirty and not oiled like the factorty clippers. Not sure if they used...rebuilt or fakes. Returned same day for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible switch
customer_reviews.text: The motor is so weak that when you put a blade and a comb on it it dies. I’ve ordered two now and the second was worse than the first. I really wish they would bring back the andis super 2 speed. Who needs 5 speeds and the on off switch never works right. Love how light it is and makes a good cut if you can get it to go on and stay on but needs a different switch and a stronger motor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart in less than 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the size and how light they are. But the part that covers the blade drive kept falling off, I called Andis and they sent a replacement part for free but that one fell off 2 weeks later. Also noticed the clippers would sound almost like they were overworked before my day even started. I wish they could improve the quality of the device and I would be happy to buy it again :/
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Heath Breedlove

customer_reviews.title: Makes grooming faster even on the extremely thick coats of poodles
customer_reviews.text: Makes grooming an easy task. Definitely need cooling spray because the clippers do tend to get hot to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: B. Freed

customer_reviews.title: The product is very quite but it should last more than 2 groomings.
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to use it and it broke when grooming my second dog. The top lid broke broke and now I have to fool around with it to get the blade off. Other than that, the product is awesome. I wish it would last more than 2 groomings.
customer_reviews.author: Felo

customer_reviews.title: Keep scrolling
customer_reviews.text: These cut good, but heat up so, so fast. Not really what I wanted. I wanted to get through the daunting task of shaving my dramatic dog faster, not burn the hair off of her...
customer_reviews.author: jdm

customer_reviews.title: Blade arrived broke so disappointing 🥺
customer_reviews.text: Take so long to Amazon delivery my Proclip Excel 5 speed and when arrived the blade was broken and the clipper was used.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Run hot, loud, vibrate.
customer_reviews.text: Heats up super fast. Quite loud. Moderate vibration. Motor sounds like it runs unevenly. Not quite the quality standards I was expecting for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shea Hanover

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had known years ago!
customer_reviews.text: The difference in the money is worth it. Love how quiet they are and the horses noticed also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pink andis Excel 5 speed. When I received package, it was opened AND not even an Andis clipper, but a Wahl!! What???
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Gets very hot quickly!
customer_reviews.text: only good if you have a quick trim job to do, because they get extremely hot, and will burn your dog's skin!
customer_reviews.author: toby2b2

customer_reviews.title: Favorite clippers yet
customer_reviews.text: Favorite clippers yet! Small and easy/comfortable to hold, quiet, and easy to maintain. The removable back makes blade drive replacement a cinch and I haven't had an issue with my cord since I've had them :)
customer_reviews.author: Tori T.

customer_reviews.title: Review of the Andis 5 speed dog clippers
customer_reviews.text: I am a dog groomer so I purchased the Andis dog clippers, after only a month of use the motor started making a terrible noise. The other groomers in the shop have also had trouble with this brand of clippers. I am still in the process of returning the item. There is suppose to be a l year warrenty so we will see.
customer_reviews.author: mary ann mallory

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: Just started using them. They feel much cheaper then the ones I had before. Not sure if it’s just the different style case? Also the the buttons seem less Steadier then my old ones ( again I’m not sure if it’s just the case). The clippers also sound louder then my older ones but that also could be the different type of case. So I’m honestly not sure how well they work. Time will tell...
customer_reviews.author: Erica Menebhi

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have been using clippers from the local big box store. These were recommended by a groomer. They feel well made and changing blades is a breeze. Hope to use them for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Denise F

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This product by was awful. Order a pair of clippers and brand new out of the box did not work. So return and got a replacement pair of clippers, and these were used, you can tell the box had been opened, and the clippers hair hair on them and the blade had some rust on it.... returned for full refund. I do not recommend these clippers to anyone, very unhappy with the Andis clippers.
customer_reviews.author: John Massie

customer_reviews.title: A must try for dog groomers!
customer_reviews.text: Been using in our dog grooming shop for years. Love it! Sturdy yet light weight and gets the job done even on our heavy coated canines.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Maher

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it for long but I love the different speeds and mine came with a free $40 trimmer. The low speed is great for dogs who are afraid of clippers and the high speed does a more finished look!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey B.

customer_reviews.title: Please note:  this is an OLDER model
customer_reviews.text: I just want to save someone the time and aggravation that I went through. This is advertised as model number 65425, which is an older model of the Excel 5 Speed (note, no "+" sign) and is no longer even listed in the documentation on the Andis website. If you want the newer Excel 5 Speed+ in pink, you need to look for model number 65430 or 65410 which advertise Quad Force blade drive technology. Just be aware of what you are actually purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: CdnShopper

customer_reviews.title: Groomer
customer_reviews.text: Only last a year I use to get them last me 3 years to bad for the price but I still buy there my favorite
customer_reviews.author: Kd

customer_reviews.title: Might be good in other areas but hated it because we couldn't get the head to stay on after taking off to clean
customer_reviews.text: It advertised as easy detach to clean - this is true, but we couldn't get it to EASILY snap back in place.
customer_reviews.author: Camilleyellow

customer_reviews.title: The best clippers
customer_reviews.text: These clippers were great. Made the grooming a lot faster..
customer_reviews.author: Pooh

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Andis is, and always be my favorite brand to buy clippers.
customer_reviews.author: H.Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Clipper
customer_reviews.text: I love this clipper....It is light weight, and the slim line feature helps me get under arms and legs of dogs more safely. I don't see where it is any different from the other clippers as far as the heating up of the blade. I would recommend this product highly!!!!! Also...this clipper is made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Kate

customer_reviews.title: Cuts fantastic but so hot after 10 minutes use you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Cuts fantastic but so hot after 10 minutes use you have to just stop in the middle of grooming. 20 mins later was cool enough to start back and not 5 mins later its hot again.
customer_reviews.author: April Moore

customer_reviews.title: We were disappointed in these clippers
customer_reviews.text: We were disappointed in these clippers, although we could've gotten a lemon. The casing on ours appeared misaligned and we could increase the speed on the clippers, but weren't able to decrease it again. They seemed quite poorly made for both the price and the previous positive reviews we had read.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Otto

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific trimmer- cuts easily thru my golden doddle’s hair
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed no guards
customer_reviews.text: Came without blades and I can’t find them to buy the right ones for the shaver
customer_reviews.author: Kim F.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this clipper. I am a professional groomer and it stands up to a lot of work
customer_reviews.author: Shirley shields

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers if they actually work
customer_reviews.text: I got these January 21 and February 22 they wouldn’t turn on and then it did but it would only go up to the number two level of power.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G.

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot quickly
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight of this clippers but it gets hot and the blades get hot fast. Not good for all day grooming.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Groomer

customer_reviews.title: Hot blade
customer_reviews.text: I love the detachable blade feature... however the blade gets so hot that I’m afraid it will burn my dogs! I kept the plastic guard on so the metal didn’t touch their skin... maybe I’m doing something wrong.. I have two westies and their coats are thick and dense and it cut very easily!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Owned for 3 months and now the switch is no good... literally useless waste of $200. Looked on news groups, this is a common and known issue by Andis... they clearly haven’t done anything to fix it
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Light , powerful and a bit loud
customer_reviews.text: Great clippers. Just a little louder than the wahls 2 sped pro. They did get a bit hot
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robert C. Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend these had them for a week before they died ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend these had them for a week before they died and already had to buy another cord
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.text: Within a month they stopped turning on when a blade was attached. I have nothing but problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kite

customer_reviews.title: Runs HOT almost immediately 😡
customer_reviews.text: This came with no attachment’s thought it was misleading. Refers to running cool and 2 minutes in it was warm and getting hotter. Not thrilled wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clippers ok ... Not great
customer_reviews.text: Did not cut that great & really got hot. I think you either get a good set or you don't. It's just a crap shoot with these clippers. I have a poodle with allergies & some mats but even with some parts combed out we had to cut her down all the way to skin. Now she looks sad. 4 stars cause they kinda cut great the first day, down hill after that
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Best clipper ive bought
customer_reviews.text: This clipper is amazing ! Smaller then my old andis clipper and lighter. This new clipper is very quiet even with a snap on comb attached. Very impressed. Love the 5 different speed settings. This clipper paid for itself after 1 shift. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The razor didn’t arrive with different sizes or various clips
customer_reviews.author: Ms. V

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a dream. Very happy with purchase. Well made product worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Kellum

customer_reviews.title: These clippers are so quite! Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the low sound great grip and I got pink so very stylish and lite to hold! My second set these are perfect on my Golden doodle hair !

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !
customer_reviews.text: This clipper is amazing! I have 2 mini schnauzer and I have bought several pair of clippers that failed to do the job. These cut quick and quiet the dogs don't like the groomers so I have to take care of them at home and now the job will be easy for all of us. Thanks Andis .
customer_reviews.author: Susan McKay

customer_reviews.title: Not to good for all day use
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like where the on and off button is, I kept shutting of by mistake , the little plastic piece that you take off to change the blade drive kept falling off and the heated up fast. But they were light
customer_reviews.author: Gramie

customer_reviews.title: Too many problems so early in use time
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 2 weeks. Loved it but it would change speeds without me touching the small buttons. The plastic part on top near blade was getting loose. Returned it due to incidents
customer_reviews.author: Joyce B.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale for 78 dollars, so I guess I can't complain too much. I ordered silver but got pink. Still cute but not what they said I was getting. They sound louder than they should,like the blade drive is bad,which it shouldn't be unless they're used. But like I said, almost half the price of anywhere, I'll take it.
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline barba

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's been the best trimmer. Easy to clean. Buy the magnet attachments
customer_reviews.author: DonMarie

customer_reviews.title: Only thing that works on our Giant Schnauzers
customer_reviews.text: We've tried 3 different clippers prior to these. They were the 1st to get the job done. Would recommend going wireless if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Power button acted up almost immediately.
customer_reviews.text: The power button acted up almost immediately. They are light weight and cut well but the power button is very important.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: They are much quieter than the pair I used to use and I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use these to groom my Mini Schnauzer. They are much quieter than the pair I used to use and I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Michel

customer_reviews.title: Love it, it's so powerful and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Love it, it's so powerful and lightweight! The only downfall is that the cord is notorious for winding itself, which can be the reason why so many reviewers have had cord problems and needed new cords for it.
customer_reviews.author: Raie

product_meta.title: Andis Excel Pro-Animal 5-Speed Detachable Blade Clipper - Professional Animal/Dog Grooming
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueLightweight, five-speed rotary motor provides MORE control - up to 4, 500 strokes per minute
detachable blade design for easy cleaning and greater versatility from a wide range of blade choices
perfect for all coats and breeds
soft-grip design for comfort and sure handling
ceramicedge blade stays up to 75% cooler than steel, provides increased durability and a long-lasting edge
feature_bullets: Powerful, rotary motor clipper for complete animal grooming. Rotary Motor 120 Volt, 60 Hertz, MAX 4500SPM
Detachable blades for easy changing and detachable blades for easy changing and cleaning
New anti-slip soft grip housing is contoured to fit your hand.Body Material:Polymer

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
